comments:
I created a Plug-in Development/Plug-in project named "Hello World Plug-in" in
directory O:\Dev\Ron\HelloWorldPlugin.  

1. In the wizard, the class name defaulted to "Hello World Plug-in.Hello World
Plug-inPlugin", which created uncompilable source code.  

2. I then deleted and recreated the project fixing the invalid class name
(changed to HelloWorld) in the wizard.  On finish, an error occured (.log
contents follow).  

3. Lastly, the project was created as a subdirectory of the Project contents
directory, instead of using the supplied directory as the top level for the
project (as happens with Java projects), i.e. "O:\Dev\Ron\HelloWorldPlugin\Hello
World Plug-in" instead of "O:\Dev\Ron\HelloWorldPlugin".
